intro: Amsinckia latiflora, commonly known as the broadleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant has hairy, lobed leaves and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Amsinckia latiflora is also known for its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
